LaÅ¿tly, Å¿ome may Å¿ay, MuÅ¿t theiÅ¿e beinge once imployed in this Office, ever remaine in this Office, and not be imploied in other Offices of the Kingedome? div.p:

TheiÅ¿e things I write of our ParriÅ¿hes in populous Cityes, vvhere the neereneÅ¿s of dwellinge, and multitude of Å¿trangers lodged, cauÅ¿eth a very great Congregation in a Å¿male quantity of grounde; but in the Country, where in a very large circuite

If it be now demanded, what I accoumpt conveniently often, I anÅ¿were, once upon the Sabbaoth day, if not twice; for uuly, Monthly Sermons Å¿erve not, cither for the Å¿ufficient inÅ¿tructinge of people in the Divine MyÅ¿teries, or for the reprooÅ¿e of their evellManners. div.p:
EXperience hath declared, that the Kingedome of Heaven hath increaÅ¿ed, and Sathans Kingedome decreaÅ¿ed, by the GhoÅ¿pells beinge MiniÅ¿tred by Men, vvho have an inÅ¿eazoning of the Spirit of God; therefore every childe of the Kingdome of Heaven, as he loveth the prevaylinge of the one, & declyninge of the other Kingedome, Å¿o he is to love, cheriÅ¿h and Å¿uÅ¿teine to his Power, Å¿uch MiniÅ¿ters of the vvorde, as have cvidence of an inÅ¿eazoninge of the Spirit of God. Suffer me therefore (Dread Soveraigne) I humbly pray you, to Å¿et before your viewe in a breife manner, the diverÅ¿e Å¿orts of MiniÅ¿ters, which I fynde in this your Kingdome of ENGLANDE, and the diverÅ¿e effects in your people of their diverÅ¿e manner of executinge their MiniÅ¿trations; that Å¿o it may by the effects and Fruicts appcare, vvho be thoÅ¿e MiniÅ¿ters vvho cheifely have an evidence of an inÅ¿eazoninge of the SPIRIT of GOD.

Some are admitted MiniÅ¿ters in the Church of Englande, vvho neither by the Spirit, nor yet of induÅ¿trious Study cann Preach at all; therefore they content themÅ¿elvs to reade Divine Service onely, or at the moÅ¿t to reade Å¿ome tymes a Homily to their PariÅ¿hioners. Here, what faith? vvhat Sanctification? vvhat feare of God? vvhat talke of religious thinges? here you may fynde Å¿ome duÅ¿ty Bibles in familyes, but they Å¿erve not for any uÅ¿e all the yeate longe, Å¿ave onely to carry to Church on Sundaies.
